intro: Acosta isernii, commonly known as the Iberian bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and prefers sunny to partially shaded environments. It is a perennial herb with a compact growth habit and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native habitat.
